boards.name: AmphionAgent Launch Command Deck
boards.description: Command deck for AmphionAgent (BlackClaw) using MCD protocol.

cards.title: v0.01a - Scaffold Baseline
cards.description: Validate guardrails, canonical milestone, and startup flow for the new project.
cards.acceptance: - MCD directories exist.\n- GUARDRAILS.md is created.\n- Launch Command Deck is reachable.

cards.title: v0.01a - Project Charter + PRD Baseline
cards.description: Capture charter, strategy baseline, and high-level PRD before implementation contracts.
cards.acceptance: - Charter and PRD drafts exist in strategy docs.\n- Scope boundaries are explicit.

cards.title: v0.01a - First Contract + Execute Slice
cards.description: Write first build contract and execute one deterministic slice end-to-end.
cards.acceptance: - Contract is approved.\n- Implementation validates against acceptance criteria.

cards.title: CT-017 · v1.4 — AI Derivation Follow-Through
cards.description: Close the UX gap in the source-documents wizard path. After stub Charter/PRD documents are written, the extension currently emits a passive notification with no actionable next step. This contract funds two improvements: (1) an embedded agent prompt directive block inside both stub templates, giving the AI agent explicit instructions when the file is opened; (2) an enhanced closing notification with 'Open Charter' and 'Open PRD' buttons that drop the operator directly into the stub document. Contract: CT-20260221-OPS-017.
cards.acceptance:
- Both stub templates contain a [!NOTE] agent prompt block after the [!IMPORTANT] alert.
- Prompt text is accurate and complete for both Charter and PRD variants.
- Closing notification includes 'Open Charter' and 'Open PRD' action buttons.
- Buttons open the correct timestamped file in the VS Code editor.
- Manual 6-prompt path is unaffected.
- TypeScript compiles with zero errors.
- package.json version is 1.4.0.

cards.title: CT-018 · v1.5 — Explicit MCD Command Files
cards.description: Scaffold four canonical MCD phase command files (EVALUATE.md, CONTRACT.md, EXECUTE.md, CLOSEOUT.md) into every new project under referenceDocs/00_Governance/commands/. Each file is a structured, agent-agnostic instruction brief with YAML frontmatter. Thin environment adapter files route from each IDE's native convention (Antigravity workflows, CLAUDE.md, AGENTS.md, .cursorrules) to the canonical definitions. Antigravity is the primary delivery target. Project name and codename are interpolated at scaffold time. Contract: CT-20260221-OPS-018.
cards.acceptance:
- All four command files written to referenceDocs/00_Governance/commands/ on scaffold.
- Each file has correct YAML frontmatter and all four sections (When, Inputs, Instructions, Output).
- .agents/workflows/ contains four routing workflow files.
- CLAUDE.md written to project root with MCD routing table.
- AGENTS.md written to project root.
- .cursorrules written to project root.
- No existing scaffold files overwritten.
- TypeScript compiles with zero errors.
- package.json version is 1.5.0.

cards.title: CT-019 · v1.6 — Deterministic Issue Numbers on Cards
cards.description: Add a persistent, human-readable issue number to every Kanban card. Scheme: {PREFIX}-{NNN} (e.g., AM-001) where PREFIX is the first 2 uppercase chars of the board codename and NNN is a zero-padded board-scoped counter that never reuses numbers after deletion. Displayed bottom-left of each card as a muted monospace badge. Priority badges (P0/P1/P2) are preserved unchanged. Change spans: state.json schema (issueNumber on cards, nextIssueNumber on board), server.py + server.js (auto-assign on card creation), app.js + styles.css + index.html (render badge), init_command_deck.py (seed cards get AM-001/002/003). Existing cards without issueNumber display '—'. Contract: CT-20260221-OPS-019.
cards.acceptance:
- New cards receive correctly formatted issueNumber (e.g., AM-004).
- Badge visible in bottom-left of each card.
- Pre-migration cards display '—' without error.
- Priority badge unchanged in position, style, and behavior.
- nextIssueNumber increments correctly; never reused after deletion.
- Cloned boards inherit source counter and issue numbers.
- init_command_deck.py seeds AM-001/002/003 and sets nextIssueNumber: 4.
- Both server.py and server.js implement identical behavior.
- Both ops/ and extension/assets/ Command Deck copies updated.
- package.json version is 1.6.0.

cards.title: CT-020 · v1.7 — Server State Hot-Reload
cards.description: Eliminate the need to restart the Command Deck server when state.json is modified externally (by an AI agent, direct file edit, or future toolchain integration). Add a POST /api/reload endpoint that forces the server to re-read state.json from disk and replace its in-memory state without a process restart. Also adds a 'Reload State' button to the sidebar Utilities section. Both server.py and server.js must implement the endpoint identically. Applies to both ops/ and extension/assets/ copies. Contract: CT-20260221-OPS-020.
cards.acceptance:
- POST /api/reload returns {ok: true, state: ...} with freshly read disk state.
- External writes to state.json are visible after reload with no server restart.
- Reload State button appears in sidebar Utilities and triggers a full board refresh.
- Reload is thread-safe — concurrent requests during reload do not corrupt state.
- Both server.py and server.js implement identical behavior.
- Both ops/ and extension/assets/ copies updated.
- package.json version is 1.7.0.

cards.title: Verify Command Deck Issue ID Rendering
cards.description: Test card to verify that the UI correctly renders the issueNumber badge on frontend clients.
cards.acceptance: - Issue number badge is visible on the card.\n- Badge reads correctly.

cards.title: Verify Command Deck Auto-Reload (Hot Replacement)
cards.description: Test card to verify that the app.js background polling architecture seamlessly fetches and re-renders the DOM upon detecting an mtime mutation, without requiring a manual browser refresh.
cards.acceptance: - QA card appears on the board natively without manual intervention.\n- No console polling errors.\n- Issue number badge behaves normally.

cards.title: CT-021 · v1.25.0 — Marketplace Polish + GH CLI Enablement
cards.description: Execute the release-hardening slice for AmphionAgent: install/authenticate GitHub CLI, establish public remote provenance, and finalize extension marketplace readiness (metadata normalization, package boundary cleanup, README/changelog modernization, and scoped Product Owner -> Product Manager terminology updates). Status: gh installed/authenticated, repo created, origin configured, first push remediated, metadata/docs/icon updates complete, and packaging checks pass. Contract: 202602221636-CONTRACT_MARKETPLACE_POLISH_GH_ENABLEMENT.md.
cards.acceptance:
- gh is installed and authenticated.
- origin remote is configured and main is pushed with upstream tracking.
- .vscodeignore excludes *.vsix packaging artifacts.
- package.json reflects approved proprietary metadata and repository URL.
- README/changelog are updated for current slash-command workflow.
- Scoped terminology normalization is completed and mirrored.
- Validation checks pass with no new blocking errors.

cards.title: EVAL · Light Theme Toggle Regression
cards.description: Evaluation confirms the missing light-mode toggle is a frontend regression caused by copy drift. Both runtime and extension asset launch-command-deck frontend copies no longer contain theme-toggle wiring, while command-deck-source still does.
cards.acceptance: - Root cause documented in findings file.\n- Scope for deterministic repair is defined.\n- Runtime, extension asset, and source copy reconciliation is planned under contract.

cards.title: EVAL · Safe Light Toggle Repair Plan
cards.description: Operator requested assurance that light-toggle repair will not destabilize a currently healthy app. Evaluation defines a non-disruptive rollout: stage on preview port, run smoke checks, then apply synchronized patch to runtime and extension asset copies.
cards.acceptance: - No-downtime rollout plan is documented.\n- Safety acceptance checks are explicit.\n- Scope excludes backend/API and limits to theme/frontend sync.

cards.title: CT-022 · Safe Light Toggle Restore
cards.description: Contract for no-downtime restoration of Command Deck light/dark theme toggle. Execution is staged: patch runtime frontend with surgical theme deltas, validate smoke checks, then synchronize extension asset and command-deck-source copies to eliminate drift. Contract: 202602221653-CONTRACT_SAFE_LIGHT_TOGGLE_RESTORE.md.
cards.acceptance:
- Theme toggle button appears in header.
- Toggle switches dark/light and persists across refresh.
- Existing behaviors remain intact (issue badges, reload, board/card operations, tab navigation).
- ops, extension assets, and command-deck-source frontend copies are synchronized.
- No new blocking runtime errors.

cards.title: EVAL · Light Mode WCAG Contrast Failures
cards.description: Accessibility evaluation identified confirmed AA contrast failures in light mode after toggle restoration. Failing areas include milestone badge text, primary/danger button label text, and issue badge text opacity treatment. Findings documented in 202602221701-LIGHT_MODE_WCAG_CONTRAST_EVAL.md.
cards.acceptance: - Failing selectors and ratios are documented.\n- Scope for contrast hardening contract is defined.\n- Runtime + mirrored copy remediation path is identified.

cards.title: CT-023 · Light Mode WCAG AA Hardening
cards.description: Contract to resolve confirmed light-mode contrast failures (milestone badge, primary/danger buttons, issue badge) to WCAG AA thresholds using scoped CSS-only changes, then synchronize runtime, extension asset, and command-deck-source copies. Contract: 202602221703-CONTRACT_LIGHT_MODE_WCAG_AA_HARDENING.md.
cards.acceptance:
- Failing selectors meet AA contrast targets in light mode.
- Dark mode remains intact.
- All three styles.css copies are synchronized.
- Build log and walkthrough records are produced.

cards.title: EVAL · Edit Dialog Issue Number Hotfix
cards.description: Evaluation confirms issueNumber is already available on card objects and rendered on board cards, but the edit-task modal header lacks a dedicated issue number slot and binding. Scope is a minimal UI hotfix to show issue number in the header upper-right from the same data source.
cards.acceptance: - Root cause documented with source references.\n- Scoped UI-only fix path defined.\n- No backend/schema changes required.

cards.title: CT-024 · Edit Dialog Issue Number Hotfix
cards.description: Contract to add issue number display in the edit-task modal header upper-right, bound from the same card.issueNumber source used on board cards, with proper fallback for new-card dialogs and synchronized frontend copies. Contract: 202602221710-CONTRACT_EDIT_DIALOG_ISSUE_NUMBER_HOTFIX.md.
cards.acceptance:
- Existing card edit dialog shows issue number in upper-right header.
- Value is sourced from existing card.issueNumber field.
- New card dialog fallback behavior is correct (no stale value).
- Save/delete flows remain intact.
- Frontend copies are synchronized and documented.

cards.title: EVAL · Marketplace + GitHub Readiness Re-Check
cards.description: Re-evaluation confirms publishing prep is still blocked at GitHub setup and marketplace polish. gh CLI remains unavailable, no git remote is configured, package metadata is incomplete, .vscodeignore does not exclude *.vsix, README is outdated for current workflow, and CHANGELOG is missing.
cards.acceptance: - Current blockers are documented with concrete file/tool evidence.\n- Scope to unblock publishing is clearly defined.\n- No runtime architecture changes required.

cards.title: EVAL · Missing /board Command in Cursor
cards.description: Evaluation confirms canonical BOARD docs exist and extension scaffolder supports board generation, but this repository's Cursor command surfaces are missing .cursor/rules/board.mdc and .cursor/commands/board.md. Root cause is local routing artifact drift between .agents and .cursor files.
cards.acceptance: - Root cause is documented with file-level evidence.\n- In-scope recovery actions are explicit for next phase.\n- Extension-side generation status is verified.

cards.title: CT-025 · Restore /board Command Parity
cards.description: Contract to restore missing Cursor /board command artifacts in this repository (.cursor/rules and .cursor/commands), validate parity across command surfaces, and verify extension scaffold/template support for board generation remains intact.
cards.acceptance:
- .cursor/rules/board.mdc exists and routes to canonical BOARD.md.
- .cursor/commands/board.md exists and routes to canonical BOARD.md.
- Board parity is validated across .agents, .cursor/rules, and .cursor/commands.
- Extension scaffold/template support for board is verified (patched only if needed).
- Execution/build log artifacts are produced.

cards.title: EVAL · GitHub Push Transport Disconnect
cards.description: Evaluation confirms the push failure is real (HTTP 400 + sideband disconnect). Remote main branch is not created, ls-remote returns no refs, and GitHub repo defaultBranchRef is empty. Provenance remains blocked pending first-push transport remediation.
cards.acceptance: - Terminal evidence is captured and interpreted correctly.\n- Remote branch absence is verified via git and GitHub API.\n- Remediation scope is explicitly defined for next phase.

cards.title: CT-026 · GitHub First-Push Transport Remediation
cards.description: Contract to remediate first-push transport failure (HTTP 400 + sideband disconnect), establish origin/main, and verify branch creation via git refs and GitHub API without destructive git operations. Contract: 202602221748-CONTRACT_GITHUB_FIRST_PUSH_REMEDIATION.md.
cards.acceptance:
- Push remediation attempts are traceable.
- origin/main is created and verifiable.
- GitHub default branch is established or explicitly documented.
- No destructive git operations are used.
- Execute and walkthrough logs are produced.

cards.title: EVAL · MCD Guide Playbook Drift in Packaged Build
cards.description: Evaluation confirms fresh v1.25 scaffolded environments can show outdated MCD Guide content because scaffolder writes playbook from src/templates/playbook.ts (still 4-phase), while canonical docs/assets were updated to 5-phase with /board and Halt-and-Prompt. Root cause is dual-source content drift.
cards.acceptance: - Drift source path is explicitly identified.\n- Impact on fresh installs is documented.\n- Scope for deterministic sync fix is defined.

cards.title: CT-027 · Remediate Playbook Drift + Rebuild v1.25.0
cards.description: Contract to align scaffold playbook template with canonical 5-phase MCD guidance, regenerate compiled template output, and rebuild a corrected amphion-agent-1.25.0.vsix for fresh-install validation. Contract: 202602221802-CONTRACT_PLAYBOOK_DRIFT_REMEDIATE_REBUILD_1250.md.
cards.acceptance:
- src/templates/playbook.ts contains canonical 5-phase guidance.
- out/templates/playbook.js is regenerated and aligned.
- rebuilt amphion-agent-1.25.0.vsix is produced.
- fresh scaffold path reflects updated playbook wording.
- execute and walkthrough records are created.

cards.title: EVAL · Extension-Only Public Repo Strategy
cards.description: Evaluation confirms current public origin/main contains broad workspace scope (3455 tracked files). To keep public provenance limited to extension package source, recommended path is a dedicated extension-only repository strategy; .gitignore/.vscodeignore alone cannot remove already-published files.
cards.acceptance: - Current remote scope is quantified and evidenced.\n- Safe strategy options are documented with recommendation.\n- User questions (how/where/assistance/walkthrough) are answered.

cards.title: CT-028 · Extension-Only Repo + Marketplace Publish Assist
cards.description: Contract to establish extension-only public repository provenance, align extension metadata links, validate packaging, and assist with Marketplace submission through interactive checkpoints (publisher/token/confirmations). Final status: extension-only repo is created and populated, metadata aligned, package validation passed, and Marketplace publication succeeded for active-twist.amphion-agent v1.25.0. Contract: 202602221818-CONTRACT_EXTENSION_ONLY_REPO_AND_MARKETPLACE_PUBLISH.md.
cards.acceptance:
- Extension-only repo exists with scoped source content.
- Non-extension workspace files are excluded from extension public provenance.
- package.json repository URL is aligned.
- 1.25.0 package validation passes.
- Marketplace submission is completed or blocked with explicit actionable reason.
- Execute and walkthrough records are produced.

cards.title: EVAL · MCD Distillation Alignment
cards.description: Evaluate mcd-distillation.md against current extension MCD guide and command flow. Findings: lifecycle drift (4-phase vs 5-command sequence), missing Halt-and-Prompt safety rail, and outdated setup/runtime statements requiring a NotebookLLM-targeted rewrite contract.
cards.acceptance: - Findings document exists in helperContext.\n- Gap analysis covers lifecycle, safety rail, setup/runtime, and scope drift.\n- Follow-on contract readiness is defined with acceptance criteria.

cards.title: CT-029 · MCD Distillation NotebookLLM Alignment
cards.description: Executed. Distillation aligned to current 5-command MCD flow with explicit Halt-and-Prompt rail, updated setup/runtime/existing-project claims, and synchronized source + helperContext copies. Execute log: 202602221830-EXECUTE_MCD_DISTILLATION_NOTEBOOKLLM_ALIGNMENT.md.
cards.acceptance: - Contract file exists in active contracts.\n- AFPs and scope boundaries are explicit.\n- Execute gate is clear and blocked pending approval.
